author: costin
msg: Forgot few changes - HttpServer now calls ContextManager.start(), and the
connectors are handled in ContextManager.
Also, in start() we set the default set of interceptors, if the config didn't set
it .

author: costin
msg: - Started reverse eng. MapperInterceptor,
- started to remove dependencies on Startup and HttpServer
- added few log messages to be able to trace ( can be removed for a "stable" release )
- added few more "special cases" to XMLHelper. ( i.e. in addition to the original ant
features - i.e. create and configure objects based on tag/attribute, it can deal
with a hierarchy of objects created based on the xml document.)
PR:
Obtained from:
Submitted by:
Reviewed by:

author: costin
msg: Added XmlHelper - it will read an Xml file using SAX and use invocation
to create the java objects.
This code is derived from Ant ( it used to be an attempt to replace ProjectHelper,
using SAX->Java instead of SAX->DOM->Java and with support for multi-level
hierarchy ).
It will be used initially for an alternative startup.

author: costin
msg: Added InvocationHelper - a bunch of invocation methods, mostly
from Ant.

author: shemnon
msg: Brings the XML handling in accordance with the spec, as clarified by
edward/o.  Also the xml.jsp test has been transformed as per the spec
(I think, up for review) and it has been removed from the tests since it
likely will not be working in a main line branch w/in three months.
